title: thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<dyn Any> src\lib.rs:1560:9

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
The problem happened after I forgot to add a comma in a `println` statement on the nightly toolchain. With `rustc 1.63.0` the correct compiler error message is shown. Could it be related to the msvc toolchain? On play.rust-lang.org the error message is not shown. ### Code ```Rust fn main() { let months:i64 = 3; let (year, month) = (23 as i32, 3 as u32); let total = (year * 12) + (month as i32) - (months as i32 - 1); let (year, month) = ((total / 12), (total % 12) as u32); //missing comma println!("{}/{}"year,month); } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.67.0-nightly (70f8737b2 2022-11-23) binary: rustc commit-hash: 70f8737b2f5d3bf7d6b784fad00b663b7ff9feda commit-date: 2022-11-23 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.67.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.4 ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: /rustc/70f8737b2f5d3bf7d6b784fad00b663b7ff9feda\compiler\rustc_middle\src\ty\visit.rs:103:17: expect tcx.sess.has_errors return true thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/70f8737b2f5d3bf7d6b784fad00b663b7ff9feda\compiler\rustc_errors\src\lib.rs:1560:9 ```
Backtrace
